title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) – It was a performance for the ages, a virtuoso display of offensive firepower that left an entire arena in a state of stunned reverence. On this night, Kevin Garnett was not merely a basketball player; he was a force of nature, single-handedly dismantling the New Jersey Nets and carrying the Minnesota Timberwolves to a resounding 116-96 victory.

From the opening tip, Garnett was unstoppable. He attacked the rim with ferocity, hit turn-around jumpers with flawless precision, and dominated the glass with an unmatched combination of length and desire. The Nets threw multiple defenders at him, but it was an exercise in futility. Garnett was simply operating on a different plane, scoring at will from every conceivable angle on the floor.

When the final horn sounded, the stat sheet told a story of pure, unadulterated greatness: a career-high and franchise-record 47 points. He didn't just score; he controlled every facet of the game, adding 18 rebounds, 6 assists, 3 steals, and 2 blocks. It was a complete, historic performance that underscored his arrival as one of the league's most transcendent talents.

While Sam Cassell provided a solid 19 points and 9 assists, and Stephon Marbury’s 23 points led a plucky Nets effort, this night belonged solely to Garnett. His name echoed through the Target Center as he left the court, the roar a testament to a performance that would be etched into Timberwolves lore forever. This wasn't just a win; it was a coronation.
